title: Understanding Acetylene Bonds
text: Acetylene (C2H2) is a simple alkyne with a triple bond between the two carbon atoms. Consider the types of bonds that can exist in such a molecule.

title: Types of Bonds in Acetylene
text: In acetylene, each carbon atom forms a sigma bond with a hydrogen atom and a sigma and two pi bonds with the other carbon atom. Identify these bonds in the images.

title: Identifying the C-H Bond
text: Look at the image and identify the bond between carbon and hydrogen. This is a single bond, typically a sigma bond.
